dance_form.description: The Fuchsia Petal is a war dance originating in The Tombs-Roads of Equivalence. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by any composition of The Satiny Blossom. The dancers perform in a double circle, moving to the music's nel rhythm. The calm dance is punctuated by right kicks and straight-lined arm carriage. [B]The dance begins with the introduction of the music. The dancers perform quickly with the music. This twisting understated sluggish section is punctuated by straight walks. [B]The dance enters a new section with the passages of the music. The dancers perform slowly with the music. This passive proud sprightly section is punctuated by body level changes. [B]The dance enters a new section with the bridge-passage of the music. The dancers perform very quickly with the music. This proud section is punctuated by sinuous footwork and leaps. [B]The dance enters a new section with the finale of the music. The dancers perform slower and slower with the music. This section is punctuated by spins and delicate forward bends.

The Adorable Tress is a solo celebration dance originating in The Tombs-Roads of Equivalence. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by The Fuchsia Pregnancy. The entire dance has a basic movement called the ish. There is a series of four graceful steps in a circular pattern with a passive hand gesture. The dance is punctuated by debauched right kicks, understated counterclockwise half turns and strong rightward bends.
